alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Franklin; Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 3:54PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, SOUTHERN RIPLEY, DEARBORN, NORTHWESTERN HAMILTON AND SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EDT... At 353 PM EDT, scattered strong thunderstorms were located from 7 miles northwest of Harrison to 10 miles east of Vernon, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Harrison, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Bright, Hidden Valley, Cleves, Versailles, Milan, Dillsboro, Shawnee, Moores Hill, Taylor Creek, Blue Jay, Dry Ridge, Miami Heights, Guilford, Wilmington, Logan and Manchester. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 160 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
